meanings.definition: A colorless crystalline compound with basic properties, forming uric acid on oxidation.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the purine under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The purine is an essential component in the formation of uric acid.
meanings.sent3: The purine decided to throw a party and invited all the other compounds.
meanings.sent4: The purine stood out in the chemical reaction like a shining crystal.
meanings.sent5: The purine sparkled brightly in the laboratory, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of compounds that are derivatives of purine, including the bases adenine and guanine found in DNA and RNA.
meanings.sent1: Adenine and guanine are examples of purine compounds.
meanings.sent2: The purine molecules play a crucial role in the structure of DNA and RNA.
meanings.sent3: The adenine purine told a joke to the guanine purine, making them both laugh.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic code, purine compounds are like the building blocks of a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The purine derivatives danced together in perfect harmony, creating the genetic blueprint.
